body_html:
Is there more information you can share that can help us reproduce the problem? For example, is it possible to share the graph and the C++ code used to execute it? This error might also occur if the input somehow leads to state unexpected by your model.

Could you clarify if executing the model with the same inputs works in Python but fails in C++, or does it fail in both? You mentioned "When I read it using python api everything is good but if I do it via c++ api it fails with the error", but I wasn't sure what you mean by "read it using Python api" - are you feeding the same inputs to session.run?

body:
Is there more information you can share that can help us reproduce the problem? For example, is it possible to share the graph and the C++ code used to execute it? This error might also occur if the input somehow leads to state unexpected by your model.

Could you clarify if executing the model with the same inputs works in Python but fails in C++, or does it fail in both? You mentioned "When I read it using python api everything is good but if I do it via c++ api it fails with the error", but I wasn't sure what you mean by "read it using Python api" - are you feeding the same inputs to session.run?
